catList: This course aims to provide an introduction to philosophy of social sciences and various methodological approaches in political science. Components of research design, qualitative, quantitative and mixed methods, data collection strategies, logic of inference will be discussed.  Various research design examples are provided from the recent political science literature and students are exposed to research process, article evaluation and thesis proposal writing.

This course provides an introduction to philosophy of social sciences and various methodological approaches in political science. Components of research design, measurement, validity, data collection strategies and logic of inference are discussed. Various research design examples are provided from the recent political science literature and students are exposed to research process, article evaluation and thesis proposal writing.

This course provides an introduction to philosophy of social sciences, various methodological approaches in political science and research methods and analysis. Components of research design, measurement, validity, data collection strategies and logic of inference are discussed. Various research design examples are provided from the recent political science literature and students are exposed to research process, article evaluation and thesis proposal writing. It also aims to expose students to ethical considerations in research and publishing.
